page.title: 03Woodland - Deciduous
page.content: This area of woodland in the Walkham valley is covered by tree preservation order. It is mainly semi-natural; it owes its present form to human activity e.g. coppicing and removal of large trees for timber, practices which no longer take place.The trees are predominantly oak and beech, with coppices of hazel occurring. There is a plantation adjoining Woodtown Farm with some conifers and mature oaks, chestnut, sycamore, rowan and hornbeam. There are small areas near the river where trees give way to scrub - blackthorn, sloes and hawthorn. Lack of stockproof boundaries and intrusions of sheep and ponies discourage the growth of young trees.
